title: Help understanding discrepancy of HumanoidStateTypes between PC and mobile

posts.content_html:
1. What do you want to achieve? Keep it simple and clear!
    Double/triple jump system that uses InputBegan/Mouse1Click and humanoid:ChangeState(Enum.HumanoidStateType.Jumping, true) to listen and action jumps for mobile and PC.
  2. What is the issue? Include screenshots / videos if possible!
    I have a check in my script to only permit a double/triple jump to occur if humanoid is in Enum.HumanoidStateType.Freefall state but when jumping on PC via space bar the HumanoidStateType for humanoid results in ‘Running’ but on mobile pressing the jump button results in ‘Freefall’ (both tests conducted while character is standing still). This causes a problem as PC will allow for an extra jump and mobile will be at a disadvantage.
  3. What solutions have you tried so far? Did you look for solutions on the Creator Hub?
    I don’t want to go down the route of attempting to intercept jump requests nor use JumpRequest event as it feels unreliable to me - i’m hoping that understanding the reason behind this discrepancy will help me fix the logic.
local jumpUsage = 0

if rebirth.Value >= 1 and rebirth.Value < 5 then
	jumpUsage = 1
elseif rebirth.Value >= 5 then
	jumpUsage = 2
end

local mobileJumpButton = CheckForMobileJumpButton()
if mobileJumpButton then
	mobileJumpButton.MouseButton1Click:Connect(function()
		if humanoidRootPart and humanoid then
			print(humanoid:GetState()) -- results in 'Freefall'
			if humanoid:GetState() == Enum.HumanoidStateType.Freefall then
				print(humanoid:GetState()) -- results in 'Freefall'
				if rebirth.Value >= 1 then
					if jumpUsage >= 1 then
						jumpUsage -= 1
						humanoid:ChangeState(Enum.HumanoidStateType.Jumping, true)
						print(jumpUsage)
					end
				end
				humanoid.StateChanged:Connect(function(old, new)
					if new == Enum.HumanoidStateType.Landed then
						if rebirth.Value >= 1 and rebirth.Value < 5 then
							jumpUsage = 1
						elseif rebirth.Value >= 5 then
							jumpUsage = 2
						end
					end
				end)
			end
		end
	end)
end

uis.InputBegan:Connect(function(key, gp)
	if not gp then
		if key.KeyCode == Enum.KeyCode.Space and key.UserInputType == Enum.UserInputType.Keyboard then
			if humanoidRootPart and humanoid then
				print(humanoid:GetState()) -- results in 'Running'
				if humanoid:GetState() == Enum.HumanoidStateType.Freefall then
					print(humanoid:GetState()) -- doesn't get here until space bar is pressed a second time during Freefall state
					if rebirth.Value >= 1 then
						if jumpUsage >= 1 then
							jumpUsage -= 1
							humanoid:ChangeState(Enum.HumanoidStateType.Jumping, true)
							print(jumpUsage)
						end
					end
					humanoid.StateChanged:Connect(function(old, new)
						if new == Enum.HumanoidStateType.Landed then
							if rebirth.Value >= 1 and rebirth.Value < 5 then
								jumpUsage = 1
							elseif rebirth.Value >= 5 then
								jumpUsage = 2
							end
						end
					end)
				end
			end
		end
	end
end)

-- assume you want more rebirth requirements
-- highest rebirth requirement goes first
-- {RequiredRebirths, MaxAirJumps}
-- this is ugly in my opinion
local JUMP_TIERS = {
  {5, 2}; -- 5+ rebirths = 2 air jumps
  {1, 1}; -- 1+ rebirths = 1 air jump
}

local JumpUsage = 0

-- find the correct jump limit
local function GetMaxJumps()
  for _, Tier in JUMP_TIERS do
    local ReqRebirths, MaxJumps = Tier[1], Tier[2]
    if Rebirth.Value < ReqRebirths then continue end
    return MaxJumps
  end
  
  return 0
end

local function ResetJumps()
  JumpUsage = GetMaxJumps()
end

local function PerformMultiJump()
  if not (HumanoidRootPart and Humanoid) then return end

  -- ignore inital jump
  if Humanoid.FloorMaterial ~= Enum.Material.Air then
    return
  end

  if Humanoid:GetState() ~= Enum.HumanoidStateType.Freefall then
    return
  end

  if JumpUsage < 1 then return end

  JumpUsage -= 1
  Humanoid:ChangeState(Enum.HumanoidStateType.Jumping, true)
  print("Jumps left:", JumpUsage)
end

ResetJumps()

if Humanoid then
  Humanoid.StateChanged:Connect(function(Old, New)
    if New ~= Enum.HumanoidStateType.Landed then return end
    ResetJumps()
  end)
end

local MobileJumpButton = CheckForMobileJumpButton()
if MobileJumpButton then
  MobileJumpButton.MouseButton1Click:Connect(PerformMultiJump)
end

Uis.InputBegan:Connect(function(Input, GameProcessed)
  if GameProcessed then return end
  if Input.UserInputType ~= Enum.UserInputType.Keyboard then return end
  if Input.KeyCode ~= Enum.KeyCode.Space then return end

  PerformMultiJump()
end)
